page.title: 05Ashurst: 3
page.content:
Our 12 km. block will be refered to as Ashurst although the block does not include all the parish nor only the parish. As well as the bulge of Henfield and the area of Steyning refered to above, Ashurst parish eases into the blocks to the north and west but to no great effect. The land shows no more concern for the lines surveyed by the medieval wandering bounderor than it does for those drawn by the modern metricated computor.
Ashurst is rural. It is the epitome of a certain kind of soft southern rurality dear to the heart of the most entrenched urbanite. The names across the landscape - names of shaws, fields and the farms that ARE Ashurst for its 300 inhabitants reach across the centuries and history (cont.)
